content.description:
A couple of moves on small sharp holds. The rest is fun on big positive holds.    . . (so perhaps most people will prefer to skip the crux and do it as a variation of "I Get By with"). 

  Start behind the thick evergreen tree or a bit right from it (not clear if use the same start as "I Get By with", or somehow to the right of it, or to the left of it and allow "I Get By with" to cross over from right to left. Anyway ...   Up to overhang several feet right from the thick tree, then over that and up to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).
content.protection:
Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate. 

  For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Gravitas sector.
content.location:
Find big thick evergreen tree three-quarters of the way up the steep slope.  

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Fun moves on mostly positive holds, including a mildly overhanging section. 

  Up past right side of three rocks and through overhanging section with exit on a less-positive handhold stepping left. Then up the right side of face to top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).
content.protection:
Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate. 

  For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Gravitas sector.
content.location:
Below the right end of the top wall. Or see the platform with perched rock on top below right from that which is above low outside corner/arete, and start below its left end. 

  - - > see on this Photo

climbs.name: I Get By with a Little Help From My Tree

content.description:
Lots of fun moves on big positive holds. The crux is the reaching gets tricky and then the holds get less big and less obvious. 

  Start on right side of pine tree, up overhang, then big move left to behind the tree.   . . (Is it OK to rest here by leaning back against the tree? see title?)   A little left of the tree, then up to the top. 

  Variation (similar difficulty): After squeezing past tree, instead traverse Right five feet, then straight up to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).
content.protection:
Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate. 

  For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Gravitas sector.
content.location:
Find big thick evergreen tree three-quarters of the way up the steep slope.  

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Lots of fun moves on big positive holds -- a roof and an overhang. Crux is coming over the roof where the positive holds are not as big or not so obvious. 

  Up to and through the roof to a wide ledge. Up through an overhang and on to the top (where a small tree obstructs the final exit). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).
content.protection:
Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate. 

  For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Gravitas sector.
content.location:
Diagonal-left crack leads to obvious roof about 15 ft left from below right end of upper cliff. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Interesting sustained crux sequence around and just above top of outside corner/arete. 

  Up the outside corner / arete, a bit left at its top, then straight to the top. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).
content.protection:
Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate. 

  For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Gravitas sector. 

  Can either set up an anchor at the top of the cliff, with a directional sling with carabiner on tree next to perched rock on top of lower platform. Or scramble from right side to top of lower platform and set up top anchor there.
content.location:
Below platform with perched rock on top below right from top of main cliff. Below outside corner/arete down from that platform. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Some interesting rock on its west side. 

  Longer walk than many, but not a hard walk. 

  Face on west side has rather steep slope going up left. Might find it easier to approach its base by going out around left. 

  Top-Rope: Access to top works by scrambling up around Right side. Trees and rocks can be used as natural anchors with static line or long slings. 

warning: The rock around this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber.
